resources.string: Choose a category to\n start reading

American Sydney McLaughlin has shattered her own 400m hurdles world record at the world athletics championships, leaving fans lost for words. McLaughlin, the reigning Olympic champion, was the red-hot favourite and absolutely smashed her own world record by nearly a second in the final on Saturday in Eugene, Oregon. The 22-year-old was streaks ahead of the field well before the turn and left her world-class rivals in her wake to cross the line in 50.68sec. The incredible time chopped nearly a full second off her previous mark of 51.41, set at last yearâ€™s Tokyo Olympics.
